thread.title: Seniors get free entry to national parks on Thursday
thread.title_full: Seniors get free entry to national parks on Thursday

author: Doreen Christensen
title: Seniors get free entry to national parks on Thursday
text:
Seniors get into national parks for free for Senior Skip Day on Thursday, Oct. 8. 
Senior citizens get free entry at 400 National Parks on Thursday, Oct. 8, compliments of Humana. 
The Senior Skip Day promotion waives entrance fees for those 62 and older at 400 parks, from the Everglades to Yellowstone to the Statue of Liberty. 
No coupon is necessary. Just show an ID at the entrance gate. 
Also, there will be kick off parties from 8 a.m. to 4 p.m. at Biscayne National Park in Miami and at Great Smoky Mountains National Park , which straddles the border of North Carolina and Tennessee. 
Seniors can keep going to parks for free with a Lifetime Park Pass for $10, available at select locations. 
Click here for the deal.
